headline.main: MORAL AND RELIGIOUS.; Church and Missionary Intelligence.

docs.lead_paragraph: The case of the MADIAIS has excited great attention in the religious and diplomatic circles of Europe, and the embassage from England and Switzerland to petition the Grand Duke of Tuscany has already been mentioned. The work of sympathy, and, if possible, of aid, to be taken up in this country.

headline.main: INTERVENTION IN HAYTI.; MESSAGE From the President of the United States, Mission of R. M. Walsh to the Emperor Soulouque.
LATEST INTELLIGENCE; By Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times XXXIId CONGRESS...Second Session. SENATE. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES

docs.lead_paragraph: Messrs. NORRIS, SOULE, and UNDERWOOD, appeared and took their seats. The Secretary read a letter from President KING, (who is ill,) suggesting Senator ATCHISON to take the Chair. Agreed to. Mr. BRIGHT gave notice that to-morrow he would move the reference of the President's message to the several Committees.

headline.main: CUBA.; The Crescent City Affair--Imprisonment of Capt. Gray--The English Steamers--Conduct of Judge Sharkey, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The order is at last published rescinding all previous instructions to the " Captain of the Port," and other guardians of our quiet waters, "to admit" the U. S. mail steamer Crescent City " to the port-of Havana," with almost the same privileges" as the most favored nations."
docs.abstract: Imprisoned in Cuba - interference of U.S. Consul

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-Yrok Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: The course of lectures just finished by Mr. THACKERAY, have certainly formed the best literary treat enjoyed by our citizens, these many years. His style, in point, terseness and energy, has not been equaled by any of our lecturers. His descriptions-as we would expect from a true dramatist-are the most simple, yet effective possible.

headline.main: ANNUAL REPORT OF THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR.

docs.lead_paragraph: DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR, Dec. 4, 1852. SIR: In anticipation of the approaching session of Congress, I respectfully submit the following report of the operations of the Department of the Interior.
docs.snippet: DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR, Dec. 4, 1852. SIR: In anticipation of the approaching session of Congress, I respectfully submit the following report of the operations of the Department of the Interior.

docs.lead_paragraph: DEDICATION.--To-morrow, (Sunday,) the 12th inst., the new Catholic Church recently erected at Fort Hamilton, L. I., will be dedicated to the worship of God, with appropriate exercises. The Right Rev. Archbishop HUGHES will officiate.
docs.snippet: DEDICATION.--To-morrow, (Sunday,) the 12th inst., the new Catholic Church recently erected at Fort Hamilton, L. I., will be dedicated to the worship of God, with appropriate exercises. The Right Rev. Archbishop HUGHES will officiate.

docs.lead_paragraph: SIR: I have have the honor to submit herewith a report of the various operations of this branch of the Department, since the annual report of Nov. 1851. The tabular statement marked A, presents the number of pensioners on the rolls of the United States and the District of Columbia, exclusive of navy pensioners, of whom a separate report will be made.
